ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject

Class ColorPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.ColorPoller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ColorPoller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class which takes care of color sensor polling, signal filtering as well as odometry correction using the color sensors
    Author:
    yp

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean isCorrecting
      flag indicating whether the robot is in the process of odometry correction
      static boolean kill
      a global kill switch for the poller thread
      private static int leftCounter
      a buffer used for the left sensor for line detection
      private static float leftDer
      change in sensor measurement between two iterations of the left color sensor sampling
      private static boolean leftLineDetected
      whether or not the left sensor is currently detecting a black line
      private static float leftPrev
      used to hold previous value of the left sampler
      private static float leftSample
      value from left sensor
      private static float[] leftSampleColor
      sample reading from the left color sensor
      private static SampleProvider leftSampleProvider
      sample provider for the left color sensor
      private static int rightCounter
      a buffer used for the right sensor for line detection
      private static float rightDer
      change in sensor measurement between two iterations of the right color sensor sampling
      private static boolean rightLineDetected
      whether or not the right sensor is currently detecting a black line
      private static float rightPrev
      used to hold previous value of the right sampler
      private static float rightSample
      value from right sensor
      private static float[] rightSampleColor
      sample reading from the right color sensor
      private static SampleProvider rightSampleProvider
      sample provider for the right color sensor
      private static float SENSOR_DERIVATIVE_THRESHOLD
      A threshold value used to determine a large enough change in sensor measurement

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void correctX(double[] currXYT, int updatedTheta)
      Reset the X position based on what tile the robot thinks it is on, if the robot is less than half a tile away from its current position in each direction, correction is possible
      static void correctXYT()
      corrects the odometer according to the nearest black line using internal value readings
      private static void correctY(double[] currXYT, int updatedTheta)
      Reset the Y position based on what tile the robot thinks it is on, if the robot is less than half a tile away from its current position in each direction, correction is possible
      static float getLeftSample()
      get the reading from the left color sensor
      static float getRightSample()
      get the reading from the right color sensor
      static boolean leftDetectBlackLine()
      Whether of not the left sensor is detecting a black line
      static boolean rightDetectBlackLine()
      Whether of not the right sensor is detecting a black line
      void run()
      run method for the two collor pollers
